title: tam màk hung
lang: ຕໍາໝາກຮຸ່ງ
name: Sour and spicy green papaya salad
shortDescription: One of the most common street-vendor foods, papaya salad can be eaten either as a snack, often with pork rinds, or as part of a meal. As each salad is generally made to order, it is easy to request no fish sauce or no MSG.

spice.lang: ເຜັດ ປານກາງ
ເອົາ ເຜັດ ໆ

reviews.note: I love to eat Lao Green Papaya Salad, pretty much all year round.
Spicy and pungent! Tried one with fermented crab, shrimp, and fish

ingredients.name: Garlic
ingredients.description: A kitchen staple. Lao garlic has very small cloves and is used raw in jeow and other dishes.

ingredients.name: Lemongrass
ingredients.description: Used in many Lao dishes including moke, soup, chicken sa and op (braised) dishes. When finely sliced, it is used raw in lahp or sa.

ingredients.name: Chilli Peppers
ingredients.description: May be fried wth pork or used in other stir fried dishes. Use in jeow and raw as garnish.

ingredients.name: Galangal
ingredients.description: A rhizome of plants in the ginger family. Galangal is related to and resembles ginger. While ginger tastes a little like galangal, most cooks who use both rhizomes would never substitute one for the other and expect the same flavor profile.

ingredients.name: Caffre Lime Leaves
ingredients.description: Use fresh in soup, aw lahm, Thai curries and rice noodles.
